div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 07:35 am CDT

div.div: A chance of showers and thunderstorms, then showers and possibly a thunderstorm after 2pm. High near 68. South wind 7 to 14 mph becoming north in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%.

Scattered showers before 7pm, then a slight chance of rain between 7pm and 10pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 45. Breezy, with a north northwest wind 11 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.
Sunny, with a high near 68. North northwest wind 11 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.

Counseling and Library Services - Library Resources: Juli Willhite

div.p: Julie Mooney was selected as the March Employee of the Month. Julie is in her 3 rd year teaching at Flinthills. Julie currently teaches Middle School Language Arts and 6 th Grade Social Studies. She was nominated by four people including Mrs. Swafford, Mr. Harms, Mr. Oltman, and Mr. Sorum. She is described as one who is very compassionate with kids, builds relationships well, and can use “tough . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about March 2020 Employee of the Month

h3.a: USD 492 COVID-19 Continuous Learning Letter for Social Media

div.p:
Students and Parents,
On Monday, March 30th, 2020 Flinthills USD 492 Middle and High Schools will begin the remainder of the school year under our new Continuous Learning Plan. As many of us are stressed during these transitional times we cannot express enough that your student’s teachers are also now working from home, also with no childcare and many with their own children navigating this new plan . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about USD 492 COVID-19 Continuous Learning Letter for Social Media

a.aria-label: Read more about Gamers of the Week

div.p: On Saturday, February 8, nine middle school students attended the Southern Plains Honor Band at Andover. Alex Scribner and Parker Chambers were in the White Band; Brylee Heimgartner, Katelynn Corter, and Yeva Nikolskaya-Taylor were in the Blue Band; Karynn Gleason was in the Stars Band; and Joliene Dragoo, Kianna Mantanona, and Kyle Parker were in the Rockets Band. They spent the morning and early afternoon rehearsing with . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Southern Plains Honor Band

div.p: Savannah McCreight, Ethan Stopczynski, and Laura Scribner attended the All-League Band at Southwestern College in Winfield on Wednesday, January 22. They spent the morning rehearsing as part of a band of 76 students so the sound was very different. In one piece, Ethan got to play a conch shell as well as his trumpet. After the morning’s rehearsals, they presented a concert at 2:30.

a.aria-label: Read more about SCBL All-League Band

div.p: Savannah McCreight, Tabitha Brown, and Laura Scribner attended the K-State Concert Band Clinic in Manhattan on January 24-26. As part of this weekend, they attended a Boston Brass Concert and also heard the K-State Wind Ensemble play alone and with the Boston Brass. There were 727 students attending this from all over the state of Kansas. After their auditions, they were placed in bands and handed the music Friday . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about K-State Concert Band Clinic

div.p:
Here are the Flinthills Middle School Geography Bee winners.
1st Place - Jared Stopczynski
2nd Place - Joliene Dragoo
3rd Place - Landon Boldra
The students who qualify for the State Geography Bee will compete in April.
